result.markdown:
--- title: "Likert labels" description: "A collection of labels for labelling response options in Likert-type questions." date: 2024-06-18 categories: - R - function code-tools: true code-fold: true toc: true format: html: df-print: kable knitr: opts_chunk: R.options: knitr.kable.NA: '' draft: true --- ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) library(DT) labels <- read_csv("./Likert - Labels.csv") ``` ::: ## Labels table The table below shows the same labels as in the preceding section, but you can use the search filters in each column to easily narrow down to a specific set of labels. ::: {.cell tbl-cap='Likert labels'} ```{.r .cell-code} labels |> select(-id, -symmetrical) |> mutate( options = as.character(options), option = as.character(option), variant = as.character(variant) ) |> datatable( rownames = FALSE, filter = "top", options = list( pageLength = 10, dom = "tip", columnDefs = list( list(width = "20px", targets = c(1, 2, 3)) ) ) ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ## Labels ```{.r .cell-code} labels_wide <- labels |> pivot_wider( names_from = variant, names_prefix = "variant_", values_from = label ) |> arrange(topic) topics <- pull(labels_wide, topic) |> unique() for (current_topic in topics) { subset <- filter(labels_wide, topic == current_topic) cat(paste("###", current_topic)) cat("\n\n") options <- pull(subset, options) |> unique() for (current_options in options) { subsubset <- filter(subset, options == current_options) cat(paste0("#### ", current_options, "-options")) cat("\n\n") for (i in 1:nrow(subsubset)) { cat("\n") cat(paste0(subsubset$option[i], ". ", subsubset$variant_1[i])) } cat("\n\n") } } ``` ### Bad - Good #### 5-options 1. Extremely bad 2. Somewhat bad 3. Neither good nor bad 4. Somewhat good 5. Extremely good #### 7-options 1. Extremely bad 2. Moderately bad 3. Slightly bad 4. Neither good nor bad 5. Slightly good 6. Moderately good 7. Extremely good ### Below average - Above average #### 2-options 1. Below average 2. Above average #### 3-options 1. Below average 2. Average 3. Above average #### 5-options 1. Far below average 2. Somewhat below average 3. Average 4. Somewhat above average 5. Far above average #### 7-options 1. Far below average 2. Moderately below average 3. Slightly below average 4. Average 5. Slightly above average 6. Moderately above average 7. Far above average ### Challenging #### 5-options 1. Not challenging at all 2. Slightly challenging 3. Moderately challenging 4. Very challenging 5. Extremely challenging ### Clear - Unclear #### 5-options 1. Extremely clear 2. Somewhat clear 3. Neither clear nor unclear 4. Somewhat unclear 5. Extremely unclear #### 7-options 1. Extremely clear 2. Moderately clear 3. Slightly clear 4. Neither clear nor unclear 5. Slightly unclear 6. Moderately unclear 7. Extremely unclear ### Describes Me #### 5-options 1. Does not describe me 2. Describes me slightly well 3. Describes me moderately well 4. Describes me very well 5. Describes me extremely well ### Describes My Feelings #### 5-options 1. Does not describe my feelings 2. Slightly describes my feelings 3. Moderately describes my feelings 4. Mostly describes my feelings 5. Clearly describes my feelings ### Difficult - Easy #### 5-options 1. Extremely difficult 2. Somewhat difficult 3. Neither easy nor difficult 4. Somewhat easy 5. Extremely easy #### 7-options 1. Extremely difficult 2. Moderately difficult 3. Slightly difficult 4. Neither easy nor difficult 5. Slightly easy 6. Moderately easy 7. Extremely easy #### 9-options 1. Extremely difficult 2. Very difficult 3. Moderately difficult 4. Slightly difficult 5. Neither easy nor difficult 6. Slightly easy 7. Moderately easy 8. Very easy 9. Extremely easy ### Disagree - Agree #### 2-options 1. Disagree 2. Agree #### 3-options 1. Disagree 2. Neither agree nor disagree 3. Agree #### 4-options 1. Strongly disagree 2. Disagree 3. Agree 4. Strongly agree #### 5-options 1. Strongly disagree 2. Disagree 3. Neither agree nor disagree 4. Agree 5. Strongly agree #### 6-options 1. Strongly disagree 2. Disagree 3. Somewhat disagree 4. Somewhat agree 5. Agree 6. Strongly agree #### 7-options 1. Strongly disagree 2. Disagree 3. Somewhat disagree 4. Neither agree nor disagree 5. Somewhat agree 6. Agree 7. Strongly agree #### 8-options 1. Very strongly disagree 2. Strongly disagree 3. Disagree 4. Somewhat disagree 5. Somewhat agree 6. Agree 7. Strongly agree 8. Very strongly agree #### 9-options 1. Very strongly disagree 2. Strongly disagree 3. Disagree 4. Somewhat disagree 5. Neither agree nor disagree 6. Somewhat agree 7. Agree 8. Strongly agree 9. Very strongly agree #### 10-options 1. Very strongly disagree 2. Strongly disagree 3. Disagree 4. Mostly disagree 5. Somewhat disagree 6. Somewhat agree 7. Mostly agree 8. Agree 9. Strongly agree 10. Very strongly agree #### 11-options 1. Very strongly disagree 2. Strongly disagree 3. Disagree 4. Mostly disagree 5. Somewhat disagree 6. Neither agree nor disagree 7. Somewhat agree 8. Mostly agree 9. Agree 10. Strongly agree 11. Very strongly agree ### Dislike - Like #### 2-options 1. Dislike 2. Like #### 3-options 1. Dislike 2. Neither like nor dislike 3. Like #### 5-options 1. Dislike a great deal 2. Dislike somewhat 3. Neither like nor dislike 4. Like somewhat 5. Like a great deal #### 7-options 1. Dislike a great deal 2. Dislike a moderate amount 3. Dislike a little 4. Neither like nor dislike 5. Like a little 6. Like a moderate amount 7. Like a great deal ### Displeased - Pleased #### 5-options 1. Extremely displeased 2. Somewhat displeased 3. Neither pleased nor displeased 4. Somewhat pleased 5. Extremely pleased #### 7-options 1. Extremely displeased 2. Moderately displeased 3. Slightly displeased 4. Neither pleased nor displeased 5. Slightly pleased 6. Moderately pleased 7. Extremely pleased ### Dissatisfied - Satisfied #### 5-options 1. Extremely dissatisfied 2. Somewhat dissatisfied 3. Neither satisfied nor dissatisfied 4. Somewhat satisfied 5. Extremely satisfied #### 7-options 1. Extremely dissatisfied 2. Moderately dissatisfied 3. Slightly dissatisfied 4. Neither satisfied nor dissatisfied 5. Slightly satisfied 6. Moderately satisfied 7. Extremely satisfied ### Effective #### 5-options 1. Not effective at all 2. Slightly effective 3. Moderately effective 4. Very effective 5. Extremely effective ### Extent #### 5-options 1. Not at all 2. Slightly 3. Moderately 4. Very 5. Extremely ### Familiar #### 5-options 1. Not familiar at all 2. Slightly familiar 3. Moderately familiar 4. Very familiar 5. Extremely familiar ### Frequency #### 5-options 1. Never 2. Rarely 3. Sometimes 4. Often 5. Always 1. Never 2. Sometimes 3. About half the time 4. Most of the time 5. Always #### 6-options 1. Daily 2. Weekly 3. Monthly 4. Once a semester 5. Once a year 6. Never #### 3-options 1. Rarely 2. About half the time 3. Most of the time ### Helpful #### 5-options 1. Not at all helpful 2. Slightly helpful 3. Moderately helpful 4. Very helpful 5. Extremely helpful ### How accurately #### 5-options 1. Not accurately at all 2. Slightly accurately 3. Moderately accurately 4. Very accurately 5. Extremely accurately ### How well #### 5-options 1. Not well at all 2. Slightly well 3. Moderately well 4. Very well 5. Extremely well ### Ideals #### 5-options 1. Not close to the ideal 2. Slightly close to the ideal 3. Moderately close to the ideal 4. Very close to the ideal 5. Extremely close to the ideal ### Important #### 5-options 1. Not at all important 2. Slightly important 3. Moderately important 4. Very important 5. Extremely important ### Inadequate - Adequate #### 5-options 1. Extremely inadequate 2. Somewhat inadequate 3. Neither adequate nor inadequate 4. Somewhat adequate 5. Extremely adequate #### 7-options 1. Extremely inadequate 2. Moderately inadequate 3. Slightly inadequate 4. Neither adequate nor inadequate 5. Slightly adequate 6. Moderately adequate 7. Extremely adequate ### Inappropriate - Appropriate #### 5-options 1. Extremely inappropriate 2. Somewhat inappropriate 3. Neither appropriate nor inappropriate 4. Somewhat appropriate 5. Extremely appropriate #### 7-options 1. Extremely inappropriate 2. Moderately inappropriate 3. Slightly inappropriate 4. Neither appropriate nor inappropriate 5. Slightly appropriate 6. Moderately appropriate 7. Extremely appropriate ### Incompetent - Competent #### 5-options 1. Extremely incompetent 2. Somewhat incompetent 3. Neither competent nor incompetent 4. Somewhat competent 5. Extremely competent #### 7-options 1. Extremely incompetent 2. Moderately incompetent 3. Slightly incompetent 4. Neither competent nor incompetent 5. Slightly competent 6. Moderately competent 7. Extremely competent ### Interest #### 5-options 1. Not interesting at all 2. Slightly interesting 3. Moderately interesting 4. Very interesting 5. Extremely interesting 1. Not at all interested 2. Slightly interested 3. Moderately interested 4. Very interested 5. Extremely interested ### Intervals #### 5-options 1. Never 2. Once a week 3. 2-3 times a week 4. 4-6 times a week 5. Daily ### Knowledgeable #### 5-options 1. Not knowledgeable at all 2. Slightly knowledgeable 3. Moderately knowledgeable 4. Very knowledgeable 5. Extremely knowledgeable ### Legitimate #### 5-options 1. Not legitimate at all 2. Slightly legitimate 3. Moderately legitimate 4. Very legitimate 5. Extremely legitimate ### Less concerned - More concerned #### 5-options 1. Much less concerned 2. Somewhat less concerned 3. About the same 4. Somewhat more concerned 5. Much more concerned ### Lower - Higher #### 5-options 1. Much lower 2. Slightly lower 3. About the same 4. Slightly higher 5. Much higher #### 7-options 1. Much lower 2. Moderately lower 3. Slightly lower 4. About the same 5. Slightly higher 6. Moderately higher 7. Much higher ### Much less - Much more #### 5-options 1. Much less 2. Somewhat less 3. About the same 4. Somewhat more 5. Much more #### 7-options 1. Much less 2. Moderately less 3. Slightly less 4. About the same 5. Slightly more 6. Moderately more 7. Much more ### Negative - Positive #### 5-options 1. Extremely negative 2. Somewhat negative 3. Neither positive nor negative 4. Somewhat positive 5. Extremely positive #### 7-options 1. Extremely negative 2. Moderately negative 3. Slightly negative 4. Neither positive nor negative 5. Slightly positive 6. Moderately positive 7. Extremely positive ### Preference #### 5-options 1. Do not prefer 2. Prefer slightly 3. Prefer a moderate amount 4. Prefer a lot 5. Prefer a great deal ### Quality #### 3-options 1. Terrible 2. Average 3. Excellent #### 5-options 1. Terrible 2. Poor 3. Average 4. Good 5. Excellent 1. Poor 2. Fair 3. Good 4. Very good 5. Excellent ### Quantity #### 3-options 1. A little 2. A moderate amount 3. A lot 1. Less than 2. About the same 3. More than #### 5-options 1. None at all 2. A little 3. A moderate amount 4. A lot 5. A great deal ### Reasonable - Unreasonable #### 5-options 1. Extremely reasonable 2. Somewhat reasonable 3. Neither reasonable nor unreasonable 4. Somewhat unreasonable 5. Extremely unreasonable #### 7-options 1. Extremely reasonable 2. Moderately reasonable 3. Slightly reasonable 4. Neither reasonable nor unreasonable 5. Slightly unreasonable 6. Moderately unreasonable 7. Extremely unreasonable ### Respectable #### 5-options 1. Not respectable at all 2. Slightly respectable 3. Moderately respectable 4. Very respectable 5. Extremely respectable ### Short of expectations - Exceeds expectations #### 5-options 1. Far short of expectations 2. Short of expectations 3. Equals expectations 4. Exceeds expectations 5. Far exceeds expectations ### Slow - Fast #### 5-options 1. Extremely slow 2. Somewhat slow 3. Average 4. Somewhat fast 5. Extremely fast #### 7-options 1. Extremely slow 2. Moderately slow 3. Slightly slow 4. Average 5. Slightly fast 6. Moderately fast 7. Extremely fast ### Support - Oppose #### 7-options 1. Strongly support 2. Support 3. Slightly support 4. Neither support nor oppose 5. Slightly oppose 6. Oppose 7. Strongly oppose ### Too little - Too much #### 5-options 1. Far too little 2. Slightly too little 3. Neither too much nor too little 4. Slightly too much 5. Far too much #### 7-options 1. Far too little 2. Moderately too little 3. Slightly too little 4. Neither too much nor too little 5. Slightly too much 6. Moderately too much 7. Far too much ### True - False #### 2-options 1. True 2. False #### 3-options 1. True 2. Neither true nor false 3. False #### 4-options 1. Definitely false 2. Probably false 3. Probably true 4. Definitely true #### 5-options 1. Definitely false 2. Probably false 3. Neither true nor false 4. Probably true 5. Definitely true ### Unbelievable - Believable #### 5-options 1. Extremely unbelievable 2. Somewhat unbelievable 3. Neither believable nor unbelievable 4. Somewhat believable 5. Extremely believable #### 7-options 1. Extremely unbelievable 2. Moderately unbelievable 3. Slightly unbelievable 4. Neither believable nor unbelievable 5. Slightly believable 6. Moderately believable 7. Extremely believable ### Uncomfortable - Comfortable #### 5-options 1. Extremely uncomfortable 2. Somewhat uncomfortable 3. Neither comfortable nor uncomfortable 4. Somewhat comfortable 5. Extremely comfortable #### 7-options 1. Extremely uncomfortable 2. Moderately uncomfortable 3. Slightly uncomfortable 4. Neither comfortable nor uncomfortable 5. Slightly comfortable 6. Moderately comfortable 7. Extremely comfortable ### Unhappy - Happy #### 5-options 1. Extremely unhappy 2. Somewhat unhappy 3. Neither happy nor unhappy 4. Somewhat happy 5. Extremely happy #### 7-options 1. Extremely unhappy 2. Moderately unhappy 3. Slightly unhappy 4. Neither happy nor unhappy 5. Slightly happy 6. Moderately happy 7. Extremely happy ### Unlikely - Likely #### 5-options 1. Extremely unlikely 2. Unlikely 3. Neutral 4. Likely 5. Extremely likely 1. Extremely unlikely 2. Somewhat unlikely 3. Neither likely nor unlikely 4. Somewhat likely 5. Extremely likely #### 9-options 1. Certainly not 2. Very unlikely 3. Unlikely 4. Somewhat unlikely 5. Even chance 6. Somewhat likely 7. Likely 8. Very likely 9. Certain #### 7-options 1. Extremely unlikely 2. Moderately unlikely 3. Slightly unlikely 4. Neither likely nor unlikely 5. Slightly likely 6. Moderately likely 7. Extremely likely ### Unprofessional - Professional #### 5-options 1. Extremely unprofessional 2. Somewhat unprofessional 3. Neither professional nor unprofessional 4. Somewhat professional 5. Extremely professional #### 7-options 1. Extremely unprofessional 2. Moderately unprofessional 3. Slightly unprofessional 4. Neither professional nor unprofessional 5. Slightly professional 6. Moderately professional 7. Extremely professional ### Urgently #### 5-options 1. Not urgently at all 2. Slightly urgently 3. Moderately urgently 4. Very urgently 5. Extremely urgently ### Useful #### 5-options 1. Not at all useful 2. Slightly useful 3. Moderately useful 4. Very useful 5. Extremely useful ### Useless - Useful #### 7-options 1. Extremely useless 2. Moderately useless 3. Slightly useless 4. Neither useful nor useless 5. Slightly useful 6. Moderately useful 7. Extremely useful ### Weak - Strong #### 5-options 1. Much weaker 2. Slightly weaker 3. No change 4. Slightly stronger 5. Much stronger #### 7-options 1. Much weaker 2. Moderately weaker 3. Slightly weaker 4. No change 5. Slightly stronger 6. Moderately stronger 7. Much stronger ### Will not - Will #### 5-options 1. Definitely will not 2. Probably will not 3. Might or might not 4. Probably will 5. Definitely will ### Worse - Better #### 5-options 1. Much worse 2. Somewhat worse 3. About the same 4. Somewhat better 5. Much better #### 7-options 1. Much worse 2. Moderately worse 3. Slightly worse 4. About the same 5. Slightly better 6. Moderately better 7. Much better ### Worst - Best #### 5-options 1. One of the worst 2. Below average 3. Average 4. Above average 5. One of the best ### Would - Wouldn't #### 4-options 1. Definitely would 2. Probably would 3. Probably wouldn’t 4. Definitely wouldn’t ### Yes - No #### 2-options 1. Yes 2. No #### 3-options 1. Yes 2. Maybe 3. No #### 4-options 1. Definitely not 2. Probably not 3. Probably yes 4. Definitely yes #### 5-options 1. Definitely not 2. Probably not 3. Might or might not 4. Probably yes 5. Definitely yes ## Sources
